alert.note: Alert for Ketchikan Gateway Borough (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 23 at 3:38PM AKST until November 24 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM AKST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...Ward Lake in the Southern Inner Channels. * WHEN...Until 300 PM AKST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas near Ward Lake including trails, day use areas and campground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 332 PM AKST, Trained weather spotters reported heavy rain in areas near the Ward Lake recreational area. Minor flooding of trails, the campground and day use areas near Ward Lake has been reported Wednesday afternoon. Around 2 to 3 inches of rain has fallen in the Ketchikan Area since Tuesday night with another 2 to 3 inches of rain possible through Thursday. - For Lake Connell Dam: Wednesday at 8:00am the stage was 250.8 feet. Flood Stage is 252 feet. Impacts: At 251.0 feet: Water will begin to approach low lying areas of trails and picnic areas around Ward Lake. - Areas near the Ward Lake recreational area is the most likely place to experience minor flooding.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
